messages: 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: do you think it would be worhtwhile/constructive if i update your http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/aria-html5-bis/ to take into account landmarks and changes in the aria spec etc?
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (11:24): Title: ARIA in HTML5 Integration: Document Conformance (Draft, Take Two) (at b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi)
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:25): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 and I were just discussing it on #whatwg
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:25): well, "just" meaning 2 hours ago
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:25): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: it seems like it is a little out of date with respect to both ARIA and HTML5
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:26): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 said the Relax NG schema is more current
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:26): yes, i have been studying the doc a bit

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:27): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 - I can generate human-readable HTML5+ARIA document based on Henri's aria.rnc file, if people want it
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:28): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I failed to human-read the raw ARIA file
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:28): mikesmith: that would be a useful to me
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:28): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 and I noted that templateid and datatype are gone from ARIA for example
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:28): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: OK, I will try to get it done by tomorrow

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (11:28): bugmail: [Bug 7367] New: The HTMLEmbedElement interface needs to have the name and align DOM attributes as well. Web browsers do too. <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Aug/0207.html>
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:29): yes and aria-channel and some others i think

1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:30): also in discussion with b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 a while back he agreed (as i recall) that there is a use case for the document role and also he has now allowed landmarks

1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:32): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: so i thought it would be worthwhile to produce a modified and upadted doc including suggestions on how landmarks may be supported
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:32): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: yes, I think it would be constructive. see also aria.rnc for what I did with landmarks.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:32): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: the schema has a bug around <form role=search>, though
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:32): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: the <form role=search> omission is unintentional
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:33): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: great, will work on it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:33): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: thanks
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:34): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: anyway, I think it would be great to make an updated version since b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 doesn't have time
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:35): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: good, there are some parts i am unsure about so will hassle whoever can provide input to do so :-)

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:35): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: I suspect Hixie will want to rejigger things when he gets around to this himself, but it can't hurt to have a solid proposal on the table

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:36): the document is also out of date with respect to some HTML5 element updates (like the new hgroup, header changing in meaning, datagrid, datatemplate and event-source being gone...)
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:37): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884:yes i am sure he will, yes will update in respect to html 5 elements as well
9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24 (11:39): sounds good 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f!
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:43): if i create an initial copy can somebody help me to get it up on the w3c cvs? i think it would be useful to have it up there
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (11:44): i have access to the cvs but have not worked out how to do it yet

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (11:45): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: you can slap it on the wiki for starters if you want, and I'm sure a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 can help you with the cvs mechanics
9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24 (11:45): I can try to help out, though if you're on Windows it might be tricky for me :)
9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24 (11:45): though then you could get Tortoise or something I believe and then it should be pretty easy

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (11:59): bugmail: [Bug 7368] The suggested UI for the mark element does not match the description and the examples. E.g. code highlighting is not something you want to see marked in the scrollbar. Personally I think code highlighting should just be done with strong. <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Aug/0210.html> ** [Bug 7367] The HTMLEmbedElement interface needs to have the name and align DOM attributes as well. Web browsers do to

1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:03): mikesmith: i am using tortoise, it provides a dialog for repository browsing and a filed for the address, i put in 'http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/html5' and i get a message saying "repository moved permanently to 'cvsweb/html5/' please relocate" any ideas?
9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24 (12:05): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f, shouldn't you enter the server and repository separately?
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:06): 9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24: only provides an url field, for example "http://svn.codetalks.org/repos/trunk/tools/ARIA-DTDs" works fine

9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24 (12:06): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f, per http://sourceforge.net/apps/trac/sourceforge/wiki/TortoiseCVS%20instructions you fill in the server and repository separately
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (12:06): Title: TortoiseCVS instructions ‚Äì sourceforge (at sourceforge.net)
9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24 (12:06): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f, this is not subversion
9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24 (12:07): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f, W3C uses the decades old CVS :)
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:07): thnks, as you cna see i know little about this stuff
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:07): yeah, cvs doesn't know anything about URLs
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:08): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: isn't there somewhere in the Tortoise UI where it lets you choose the type of version-control system?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (12:08): 9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24: Instead of the merely decade old SVN? :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:08): if there is, and you set it to "CVS", then it should provide a field for putting in a CVSROOT value
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:08): so will download tortoisecvs as trying with tortoisesvn will not work ;-)

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:12): maybe svn was a necessary step on the road from cvs to hg

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (12:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I still can't decide if hg, git, or bzr is the right thing
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (12:14): (git is my least favorite of the lot, but seems to have the most appeal to WebKit developers who really want that kind of tool)
9bb295af93051e68de66b2bd517b2e24 (12:15): hasn't used any of the fancy ones yet
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:15): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: How much does it matter? As far as I can tell they are similar enough to not make much difference
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (12:15): That's why svn is so great, everyone can agree it's not their favorite decentralized option
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:15): Although bzr seems like it might be sqeezed out simply by being third most popular
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (12:15): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: they seem to differ greatly in learnability for someone used to cvs/svn
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (12:16): Monotone ftw!
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (12:16): also, people who like git tend to disdain the others for reasons I am not totally clear on
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:16): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: Could be true. Git seems to be simple in principle and rather hard to learn
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (12:16): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: Probably because Linus says so
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (12:16): It's in the name, "git"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (12:17): Or rather, Linus wrote it, so they think Linus dislikes everything else
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (12:17): also I've heard it claimed bzr does not have good perf for large repositories
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:17): Although I get the impression it may be somewhat more powerful than hg I haven;t really wanted the extra features yet
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (12:17): bzr does a lot better now than it did even a year ago
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:17): sorry about starting a discussion on which DVCS is best
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (12:18): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: what's amazing is the total lack of flaming in this discussion
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (12:28): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: No, your wrong because you do work on an open source project controlled by an evil closed company!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (12:28): *you're
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (12:28): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: that's the spirit!
